H0.text: Octet rule is the concept that atoms tend to have eight electrons in their valence electron shell.

H1.text: String rule is the concept that atoms tend to have eight electrons in their valence electron shell.

H2.text: Diagonal rule is the concept that atoms tend to have eight electrons in their valence electron shell.

H3.text: Coupling rule is the concept that atoms tend to have eight electrons in their valence electron shell.

A4.text: The octet rule is a chemical rule of thumb that reflects the theory that main-group elements tend to bond in such a way that each atom has eight electrons in its valence shell.

A5.text: Many reactive intermediates do not obey the octet rule.

A6.text: Each H atom now has the noble gas electron configuration of helium (He).
